pitt.search.semanticvectors.vectors

Class ComplexVectorUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • pitt.search.semanticvectors.vectors.ComplexVectorUtils

  • public class ComplexVectorUtils
extends Object
    Complex number utilities class. Contains static methods for various operation on complex vectors.
    Author:
    Lance De Vine

      static boolean orthogonalizeVectors(List<Vector> list)
      The orthogonalize function takes an array of vectors and orthogonalizes them using the Gram-Schmidt process.
      static void renderOrthogonal(ComplexVector vec1, ComplexVector vec2)
      Renders vec1 orthogonal to the corresponding component of vec2 where orthogonality is defined by a hermitian scalar product of 0 (rather than as a mean pairwise cosine between circular vectors of 0) Both vectors are in put into CARTESIAN mode.
      static void renderPairwiseOrthogonal(ComplexVector vec1, ComplexVector vec2)
      Experimental: renders each circular component of vec1 orthogonal to the corresponding component of vec2 Both vectors are in put into CARTESIAN mode.

      • superposeWithAngle

        public static void superposeWithAngle(ComplexVector vec1,

        Superposes vec2 with vec1. vec1 is in CARTESIAN mode. vec2 is in POLAR mode.

                                      float weight,
                                      int[] permutation)
        Superposes vec2 with vec1 with weight and permutation. vec1 is in CARTESIAN mode. vec2 is in POLAR mode.

                                            ComplexVector vec2,
                                            float weight,
                                            int[] permutation)
        Superposes vec2 with vec1 with weight and permutation. vec1 is in CARTESIAN mode. vec2 is in sparse POLAR mode.

        Superposes vec2 with vec1. Both vectors are in CARTESIAN mode.

      • superposeWithCoord

                                      int[] permutation)
        Superposes vec2 with vec1 with weight and permutation. Both vectors are in CARTESIAN mode.

      • orthogonalizeVectors

        public static boolean orthogonalizeVectors(List<Vector> list)
        The orthogonalize function takes an array of vectors and orthogonalizes them using the Gram-Schmidt process. The vectors are orthogonalized in place, so there is no return value. Note that the output of this function is order dependent, in particular, the jth vector in the array will be made orthogonal to all the previous vectors. Since this means that the last vector is orthogonal to all the others, this can be used as a negation function to give an vector for vectors[last] NOT (vectors[0] OR ... OR vectors[last - 1].
        Parameters:
        list - vectors to be orthogonalized

      • renderOrthogonal

        public static void renderOrthogonal(ComplexVector vec1,
                                    ComplexVector vec2)
        Renders vec1 orthogonal to the corresponding component of vec2 where orthogonality is defined by a hermitian scalar product of 0 (rather than as a mean pairwise cosine between circular vectors of 0) Both vectors are in put into CARTESIAN mode.

      • renderPairwiseOrthogonal

        public static void renderPairwiseOrthogonal(ComplexVector vec1,
                                            ComplexVector vec2)
        Experimental: renders each circular component of vec1 orthogonal to the corresponding component of vec2 Both vectors are in put into CARTESIAN mode.
